They may come to bodhisattvas and demand their hands, feet, ears, nose, head, eyes, marrow, brain, blood, flesh, skin, wives, children, male and female relatives, as well as their countries, cities, villages, wealth, grain, gold, silver, precious stones, pearls, jade, coral, rare treasures, clothing, food and drink, and everything they possess.
Those who establish the inconceivable gate of bodhisattvas are able to use skillful means to demonstrate for other bodhisattvas the firmness of their nature.
Why is this so?
